poem:
"Upon Tides of Despair and Duty"

Kneeling in shadows, the gallant
guardians tremble,
Upon their hubris-clad shoulders, a world's burden.
Merciless Channel, claims innocence,
A squall spinning the colors of despair.
Rising, not the sea, but absences,
Our sentinels uniformed in solitude,
The calendar weeping at relentless springs.
The heart knows not of chains,
nor Freedom of Information Act,
just the relentless tide,
and an empty chair.
